review_text:
The Kleier Haus offers you the warmth of a wonderful old home with beautiful antiques and artwork while providing the modern amenities many of us have come to expect. The bathroom on the first floor has a separate shower, a spa tub, and a bidet. The upstairs baths have combination tubs and showers, and there are plenty of towels for everyone. The kitchen is outfitted with a dishwasher, garbage disposal, cooktop, oven, microwave, and many small appliances. Cook pans, casserole dishes, dinnerware, etc. allow you to prepare meals for small or large groups. There are TVs throughout the house to accommodate the varying interests of guests. The large yard gives guests plenty of room for badminton, volleyball, and other similar outdoor games. A golf course adjacent to the Kleier Haus property also is open to guests. A number of restaurants are only a short drive for pick up or dining in, as COVID restrictions allow. We stayed a week, but this location could easily accommodate longer or shorter stays. We were there to visit family and friends, but the surrounding area offers several interesting activities for visitors. The Clooney family--Rosemary, Nick, George, etc.--came from Maysville, so you can learn about their relationship with Maysville over the years. Nearby Old Washington, a 1700's village of shops, museums, tours, etc., is a nice diversion for history buffs and others who are interested in antique furniture and dishes.
We did not see our host, Page, while there, but he gave us several means of contacting him if needed. He also quickly accommodated our request to stay a couple of extra days, even though the extension gave him fewer days to prepare for the next occupants. Overall, we highly recommend the Kleier Haus when looking for a place to stay in Maysville and the surrounding area! LK, North Carolina

review_text:
If you're reading this review, it means you're considering staying at Page's gorgeous home, and I'm here to tell you that you should stop reading now, and go make your reservation before somebody else does!
Upon arrival, the outside of the home is humble yet beautiful, with a very lovely covered driveway entrance, which was extremely appreciated during our rainy stay. The huge covered porch is stunning, and makes you consider years gone by, when time went by at a slower pace. The yard and property are beautiful and wonderfully maintained and landscaped.
As delightful as the outside of the home is though, it wasn't until we stepped inside that we were truly appreciative of the beauty of this home. The family room through which you enter is warmly decorated, with big leather furniture, built-in bookshelves, and an electric fireplace. As you walk through the house, you'll find a beautifully hand-carved, curved staircase, a quiet and comfy parlor room, large dining room, huge kitchen, and very large first floor suite. The second floor has three more bedrooms that we did not use during our stay, but were also very spacious and well-decorated.
The entire home is practically presidential in decor, with lots of large oversized mouldings, 9 & 10 foot ceilings, and loads of Georgian/Greek Revival architectural details and decor. The home is so wonderfully put together, you almost forget you're inside of a simple, white farm house.
Lots to do nearby, impeccably clean, lots of little amenities, and an extremely helpful host in Page, make this your greatest possible option for a luxurious stay in Maysville without breaking the bank. Plenty of room inside and out (and parking) for a large crowd, but also quaint, quiet, and well-laid out enough for a simple retreat for two.
Five stars all the way, we will certainly be back!

The TV is upstairs in what I refer to as the media room which comes with a pull out bed and chair and a cute table. The t.v unfortunately does not come with cable just apps you can personally sign into or ot movies you can purchase which was a bummer as I accidentally forgot to sign out. I did message the host to ask if she could sign out but I assume she's very busy as her responses are a bit delayed and I still haven't received a response. My husband and I were visiting the town where I was born 87 years ago. Terry, Mary and Jay Hason's "Hippie Soul" was absolutely perfect in every way for our two week walk down memory lane. It is located on the edge of Maysville's historic downtown. The home is tastefully and comfortably furnished with a full kitchen, which served us perfectly for our style of travel (light breakfast, snacks and leftovers from dinners in severals of the local restaurants. An excellent breakfast cafe is within site of the house and a very short walk down the street. Although we didn't do much actual cooking or food preparation, we could easily have eaten all of our meals 'at home.'
We were comfortable, happy and enjoyed our central location. Although we didn't need assistance (past the first afternoon when Terry responded immediately) we knew the Hansons were available if needed. Their thoughtful array of snacks and information about eateries and places of interest was greatly appreciated.

Things we loved are the beds (!), character & charm of Hippie Soul, snacks, coffee, treats and gift cards (we enjoyed deSha’s!), and location. One night we walked to Caproni’s for dinner and that was so pleasant. The mini bar was very well stocked and fresh cookies didn’t last long after our day of driving. We loved the night lights in the kitched and bathroom outlet. The outside patio area is really nice and the desk was convenient!
Things to note at Hippie Soul: no central heat/air but plenty of little heating units and fans; you might hear dogs barking if the people below leave; the bathroom itself is quite large but the shower stall is tiny - I’m 5’10” 185 and had a hard time showering. Also you might bring a power strip to plug in your electronics. One bedroom had only one outlet which was inconvenient.
Internet worked without issue and TV/Roku was perfect!
